intro: Soldanella alpicola, commonly known as the alpine soldanella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white, pink, or purple. The plant thrives in alpine environments, often growing in rocky soils at high altitudes. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Soldanella alpicola is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows and scree slopes.
